BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
 
 The dependency fbprophet 0.7 release is breaking the build because of conflicting version requirements for the holidays package.
 fbprophet: 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/facebook/prophet/commit/3a436ec60343802e2dcc3251fe455fed7abc85d8>facebook/prophet@3a436ec</denchmark-link>
 
 Gluon-ts: 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/blob/master/requirements/requirements.txt>https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/blob/master/requirements/requirements.txt</denchmark-link>
 
 Gluon-ts: 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/blob/master/requirements/requirements-extras-prophet.txt>https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/blob/master/requirements/requirements-extras-prophet.txt</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 Run the setup: pip install --upgrade mxnet==1.6 gluonts
 <denchmark-h:h2>Error message or code output</denchmark-h>
 
 Building gluon-ts yields the error message during setup.py install for fbprophet:
 <denchmark-code> ImportError: cannot import name 'Turkey'
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
 
 
 Operating system: Amazon Linux
 Python version: 3.6
 GluonTS version: 0.5.2
 MXNet version: 1.6

comments_0.comment_text:
Hello Kenneth,
 thanks for filing the issue. I'm actually not sure why we fixed the dependency on holidays. I suspect updating the dependency should just work.
 Do you want to give it a try?

comments_1.comment_text: Looks like removing the <0.10 restriction from holidays>=0.9,<0.10 results in a working build.
